experiences.title: API Designer & Developer
experiences.description: Carbon Cash is a Michigan-based startup that rewards students for good energy usage habits. I designed and implemented an **API that supported iOS, Android, and client-side Ember web apps** and handled hosting and server maintenance.  The system was **built on Rails** and integrated with local power companies and university housing systems to retrieve data about students' energy usage.

experiences.title: Conference Talk: Service-Oriented Architecture
experiences.description: Based on a client project I created and delivered a live-coded presentation to introduce people to **Service-Oriented Architecture**. Designed to help developers break their first service out of a monolithic application, the talk covered **inter-process messaging protocols, alternative data stores, and lightweight web frameworks**

experiences.title: Web Developer & Research Assistant
experiences.description: Led by Rick Wash, the BitLab at MSU is studying economic trends of crowdfunding sites. As part of the project the team has built a crowdfunding site for use by MSU students that collects data about how people use crowdfunding systems. As the sole developer working on an existing code base I was responsible for **redesigning the site**, setting up **automated testing**, running **usability studies**, and **integrating the site with Amazon Payments**.

experiences.title: Vice President and Webmaster
experiences.description: ACM is an international organization that provides resources to students in Computer Science and related fields. As a founding member of the MSU chapter I **organized student events** including technology talks and seminars with local tech companies, programming contests, and hackathons. I also **gave presentations about programming** and the field of computer science in general.

experiences.title: Medication Shortages Dashboard
experiences.description: Through the senior design program at MSU's computer science department I worked with doctors and pharmacists at Spectrum Health to create an "issue tracker" for medication shortages. The **Rails app** used **Javascript visualization libraries** to display data pulled from the FDA, and helped pharmacists discuss and create plans to outlast shortages.

experiences.title: Software Engineering Intern
experiences.description: During my three-month internship at Microsoft I was responsible for developing a **testing framework** for third-party printer drivers in Windows 8, using **C++ and Javascript**. I worked with team members in the Sustainability Engineering department to create a tool that simplified the verification process for new printer driver submissions.

experiences.title: Digital Evolution Research
experiences.description: The BEACON Lab uses novel techniques to study evolution, including the creation and observation of **evolving computer programs**. As a research assistant I was responsible for implementing predator behavior â€“ in this case, the ability for programs to feed off of one another.  Working closely with a postdoctoral advisor I **implemented and tested the behavior in C++**. The predator-prey features provided a basis for several future publications.

experiences.title: Teaching Assistant: Introduction to Programming
experiences.description: As a teaching assistant for the introductory programming course at MSU, I **led lab sections and held help room hours**. Through grading program submissions and helping students one-on-one, I spent many hours teaching **programming concepts, techniques, and best practices**.

experiences.title: ICT Network Research
experiences.description: In my first research position I helped a team trying to understand the effects of governmental regulation of ICT networks. Working with a large base of **simulation software in Java**, I contributed by creating **interfaces to visualize dynamic networks**.
